required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Evaluation of Complications in Airway Management
clinical_study.official_title: Evaluation of Complications During Airway Management: An Observational Prospective Cohort Study

brief_summary.textblock: In the current study researchers aim to evaluate the rate of the complication due to airway management (during intubation or placement of supraglottic airway devices)

detailed_description.textblock: Airway management is one of the most important subject of anesthesia practice. Airway devices ,helping anesthesiologists to maintain airway safety have many complications. 4 th national audit project (NAP 4) study was designed to evaluate the incidence of the major complication of airway management. Accordingly in current study authors aim to determine the complications and incidence of the complications during airway management.

primary_outcome.measure: The incidence of the complications due to airway management
primary_outcome.description: researchers will observe the whole patients who undergo general anesthesia and record the data

secondary_outcome.measure: variety of complications and reasons of the complications
secondary_outcome.description: researchers will observe the whole patients who undergo general anesthesia and record the data
researchers will observe the whole patients who undergo general anesthesia and record the data

secondary_outcome.measure: the time at which complications occurs more, during airway management
secondary_outcome.description: researchers will observe the whole patients who undergo general anesthesia and record the data

arm_group.description: Patients who undergo general anesthesia and are intubated or inserted airway device will be enrolled. researchers will follow the induction and intubation period and record all the complications due to airway management.

intervention.description: patients will be intubated or will be placed an airway device

study_pop.textblock: patients who undergo surgery under general anesthesia and who intubate/place supraglottic airway device will be recruit for study over a period of six months

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Patients undergoing general anesthesia
- Patients to whom airway devices will be inserted
Exclusion Criteria:
- Patients who undergo surgery under regional anesthesia
- Patients who undergo surgery under sedation

overall_official.affiliation: Sağlık Bilimleri Üniversitesi Kocaeli Derince SUAM
